result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gionlo Jermain Finch

records.addlTxt: Email correspondence with parties. Upon Attorney Zwach's appointment to case, Court vacates Order To Show Cause Hearing previously calendared and re-calendars matter for a Preliminary Hearing on 11/07/2022 at 01:30 pm, Prelim Court.
Received and Signed. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Gionlo Jermain Finch in court.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status of Counsel hearing. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appoint counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense of $ 60.00 upon completion of case. Court will seek court appointed counsel and orders matter adjourned for an order to show cause hearing in Branch 16.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Gionlo Jermain Finch in court.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status of Counsel hearing.  Court vacates previous bench warrant and re-instates bail. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause. 
Court further informs parties that the PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Case adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

Defendant Gionlo Jermain Finch not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Received and Filed. Notice of Completion
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL FOR DEFENDANT

Defendant Gionlo Jermain Finch appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel does not appear and did not respond to the court. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/20/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Gionlo Jermain Finch in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/18/2022@2p
